posts.post_content: I'm new to the older cards, and probably pretty ignorant, but would really like to pickup atleast a couple of the 19th century cards of Cleveland players.  I do not have any yet, and honestly don't know what all is out there.  I've been lurking and reading on the boards trying to get an idea.  Ideally I'd like to pick up an old judge psa 1 of any Cleveland player.  If you have any for sale please let me know.  Might be intereseted in SGC or BVG but first choice is PSA.  I don't have anything from this era to trade, but if you are interested in any newer stuff I have some of that.  Also have paypal if looking to sell.

The price on this is not horrible...

[url]http://cgi.ebay.com/SGC-20-1887-N172-Old-Judge-Jay-Faatz-Cleveland-/200630844987?pt=US_Baseball&hash=item2eb687be3b#ht_1298wt_1141[/url]

You can wait for an auction though if you would like

thanks Matt, honestly I don't know a lot about these so I've hesitated on the couple I've seen.  I do like the way I can see the picture.  Some I've seen are PSA 5 or 6 and I can barely see the image of the player.
Yes!  Buy one with good image quality.  Go ahead and pay a premium for an example with a nice image... You will enjoy it so much more.
Thanks for the T206 purchase. I will keep you in mind for any other vintage Cleveland cards I come up with. Good luck with the new endeavor !!
